New Records: Bailey Falter carried a no-hitter into the seventh inning
Key Match Events: Bailey Falter pitched 6.2 innings of no-hit baseball
Jared Triolo hit his eighth homer of the season
The Pirates scored twice in the first inning
Jonah Bride dropped a single into left field with one out in the seventh
Otto Lopez led off with a double before Jake Burger reached on an error by shortstop Isiah Kiner-Falefa
David Bednar struck out Bride and Jesús Sánchez before Pache hit an RBI single up the middle
Jalen Beeks came in for Bednar, allowing an infield single to Stowers that loaded the bases, and got Xavier Edwards to fly out to right for his 10th save
Pre-Game Insights: Pirates manager Derek Shelton said, 'I think we're getting better. We're in a definite, much better spot than we have (been) in the last two years with our starting pitching.'
Post-Match Reflections: Miami manager Skip Schumaker said, 'Those guys fought. There's no doubt about it, they fought all three games. Had a chance to win or tie all three games. We just couldn’t come up with the big hit late.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Marlins lost each of their seven games against the Pirates this season
They were swept to open the season in Miami, losing four games by a combined score of 31-17 before dropping the past three in Pittsburgh
Jonathan Bermúdez (0-1) got through two innings for Miami, allowing three runs and three hits with one walk in his first major-league start
